diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of spinal arachnoid cyst was established after imaging studies indicated a hyperintense extradural mass compressing the sacral nerve roots and causing paroxysmal headaches, elevated intracranial pressure, and intermittent bilateral optic-disk edema. The presence of papilledema and the correlation of symtomatology suggested that the cyst contributed to transient elevations in intracranial pressure.
